##### рдХрд╛рдЮреНрдЪреА резрел рдЬрдЧрджреНрдЧреБрд░реБ рд╢реНрд░реА-рдЧрдЩреНрдЧрд╛рдзрд░реЗрдиреНрджреНрд░ рд╕рд░рд╕реНрд╡рддреА рдЖрд░рд╛рдзрдирд╛ #резремрепреи

Observed on ┼Ъukla-Pratham─Б tithi of Caitraс╕е (lunar) month (Apar─Бhс╣Зaс╕е/vyaapti). The event has been commemorated since it occurred in 3430 (kali era).  
Gaс╣Еg─Бdharag─лс╣гpatiс╕е, known as Subhadra, son of K─Б├▒ci Bhadragiri, got initiated in the twelfth year of age by ┼Ъr─л Vidy─Бghana whom He had served became a realised soul when He as twenty-four years old and reached the eternal abode of ┼Ъr─лvidy─Б and ┼Ъr─л ┼Ъiva. Vasantotsava is an annual festival conducted for three days (Trayodashi, Chaturdashi and Pournami in the month of Chaitra). During this period, Lord Sri Venkateshwara and His Consorts Sridevi and Bhudevi are taken out in a procession and brought to the Vasanta Mandapam for abhishekam. On the third day, idols of Sri Rama, Sita, Lakshmana, Anjaneya and Sri Krishna (with Rukmini and Satyabhama) are brought to Vasanta Mandapam in procession.

Observed on day 8 of April (gregorian) month. Julian date was converted to Gregorian in this reckoning. The event has been commemorated since it occurred in 1737 (gregorian era).  
One brother bAji rAv makes a dash to mogol Delhi, outmanoeuvring 2 armies; same day his younger bro chimAji appa readies to mount an attack on the Firangis.
The Badshah at Delhi slept secure in the thought that the large armies of Sadat, Bangash & Khan Dauran to his south would protect him. From Gwalior area, Bajirao rode 200 km in just 4 days avoiding all those armies & gatecrashed Delhi. Then, he defeated a well trained Mughal Army led by Amir Khan Bahadur.

#### рдЙрддреНрд╕рд╡рд╛рдГ
##### рдЕрд╡реНрд░рдЩреНрдЧреЫреЗрдмреЛ рд╣рд┐рдиреНрджреБрдХрд╢рд╛рд▓рд╛рдирд╛реЫрдореН рдЖрджрд┐рд╢рддреН #рейрелреи

Observed on day 19 of April (gregorian) month. Julian date was converted to Gregorian in this reckoning. The event has been commemorated since it occurred in 1669 (gregorian era).  
Shortly after the death of Mirza Raja Jai Singh of Amber, a general order was issued (9th April 1669) for the demolition of temples and established schools of the Hindus throughout the empire and banning public worship. Soon after this the great Temple of Keshava Rai was destroyed (Jan.-Feb. 1670) and in its place a lofty mosque was erected. The idols, the author of Maasir-i-Alamgiri informs, were carried to Agra and buried under the steps of the mosque built by Begum Sahiba in order to be continually trodden upon, and the name of Mathura was changed to Islamabad.

Observed on Am─Бv─Бsy─Б tithi of Caitraс╕е (lunar) month (Apar─Бhс╣Зaс╕е/vyaapti). The event has been commemorated since it occurred in 4267 (kali era).  
┼Ъr─лkaс╣Зс╣нha, son of ┼Ъukadeva┼Ыharma on the banks of the river Kunс╕Н─л (Kunс╣н─л) was a dr─Бviс╕Нa (a southerner), eloquent, wellversed in scriptures and courageous; having received the initiation into asceticism from the compassionate preceptor Bodhendra with the name ┼Ъr─л Chandrac┼лс╕Нa, He held the responsibilities of preceptorship on earth by remaining in K─Бс╣Еci Maс╣нha. This preceptor surrounded by eminent scholarpoets Maс╣Еka, ┼Ъr─л Jayadeva, Kс╣Ыс╣гс╣Зa, Suhala, carrying out digvijaya throughout the earth defeated in debate the exponent of Jainism Hem─Бc─Бrya, whose presence embellished the assembly of King Vidy─Бlola Kum─Бrap─Бla. This preceptor ┼Ъr─л Chandrac┼лс╕Нa meditating on the mystic syllable that dispels grief/removes misery, adorning the seat (of preceptor) for sixty-eight years, became Videha by giving up the wondrous physical body on the New moon day in Caitra month of the year P─Бrthiva in the Kali era 4267. This renowned preceptor followed ┼Ъr─л Jayadeva, Kс╣Ыс╣гс╣Зami┼Ыra, Suhala and others, adored by King Jayasimha and Kum─Бrap─Бla, destroyed the arrogance of the Jaina exponent Hem─Бc─Бrya and attained the final beatitude at Aruс╣З─Бcala.

Observed on ┼Ъukla-с╣вaс╣гс╣нh─л tithi of Jyaiс╣гс╣нhaс╕е (lunar) month (S┼лryodayaс╕е/puurvaviddha). According to historical evidences, dated 22nd March 1540 CE, the Temple was brought to worship by doing Jeernoddhaarana by Chinni Thirumalacharyulu, the grandson of great saint Sri Talapaka Annamacharyulu. In 1940 CE. an Archaka Swamulu by name Sundararaju from Tamilnadu came to Srinivasa Mangapuram. He shared his dream with villagers by saying that in his dream Lord Venkateswara Swamy appeared and asked him to bring the temple to Past Vaibhavam (glorious) by performing Deepa Naivedya Aaradhana and Lord disppeared. As per the Lord words, Archaka Swami Sundaraju performed first pooja on July 1940 which was coincided on Ashada Shudda Shasti Day with the help of village elders. To mark the auspicious day of revival of Nitya Pooja Kainkaryam, TTD has been conducting this festival as Sakshatkara Vaibhavotsavam on Ashada Shuddha Shasti Day in the Jyaishta month every year.

Observed on ┼Ъukla-Pratham─Б tithi of ─Ас╣г─Бс╕Нhaс╕е (lunar) month (Apar─Бhс╣Зaс╕е/vyaapti). The event has been commemorated since it occurred in 3649 (kali era).  
The noble son of ┼Ъr─лkс╣Ыс╣гс╣Зa of ┼Ъr─лmuс╣гс╣Зa by name ┼Ъivas─Бmbha who went round the earth thrice, became a disciple of ┼Ъr─лcitrukha through initiation, and later became the head of ┼Ъr─л ┼Ъ─Бrada maс╣нha. He (┼Ъr─л Citsukhendra), whose biography was composed by Mantha in his work titled Siddhajaya adorned the P─лс╣нha for twenty-one years and attained immortal state. He, the austere, Saccid─Бnandaghana attained immortality in the form of ┼Ъivaliс╣Еga on the first day of the bright fortnight in the month of ─Ас╣г─Бс╕Нha of Prabhava year in the ┼Ъaka era 470.

S─лt─Бpati, son of Preme┼Ыa, on the banks of river Pin─Бkin─л, received at the age of seventeen years, initiation into asceticism from preceptor ┼Ъr─л Chandrac┼лс╕Нa; that eminent preceptor defeated in debates great scholar poets ┼Ъr─л Harsha, Abhinavagupta and others and wandered three times throughout the earth. This preceptor Cidvil─Бsa, revered by all, spread the tenets of Advaita through his eloquent teachings reached Cidambaram; worshipping the Muktiliс╣Еga, He disappeared in the air in the very presence of the onlookers all around, on the tenth day of the bright fortnight of Jyeс╣гс╣нha in the year Siddharthi. This preceptor ┼Ъr─л Advait─Бnandabodhendra, also known as the author of Brahmavidy─Бbharaс╣Зavivaraс╣Зa and other works and a lion to the elephants, viz., refuting the views of ┼Ъr─л Harsha, Abhinavagupta and others in debates. His preceptorship spread over thirty-four years.

This preceptor was the son of Vi┼Ыvajit of Cidambaram through vi┼Ыiс╣гс╣н─Б; like the Sun who dispels the dense darkness veiling his presence, He was born on the tenth day of the bright fortnight in the month of Vai┼Ы─Бkha in the year Vibhava twelve months after his fatherтАЩs demise. One who was abandoned as a child in the midst of a forest by his mother herself without any possible solution to her deplorable plight, viz., widowhood, lack of shelter, servitude, insult of relatives fear of slander etc. Who, on crying at a distance was taken by the wife of Vy─Бghrap─Бda, to her home and was compassionately breastfed by her after informing her husband. The sage initiated him and imparted the ─Бtmavidy─Б. Then, the adept in self control/ascetic principles, having completed studies, well-versed in scriptures, having received the grace bestowed by the Universal Preceptor (┼Ъr─л ┼Ъaс╣Еkara) who manifested of his will before (him), and having received the mighty sacred sandals (of ┼Ъr─л ┼Ъaс╣Еkara) offered by Padmap─Бda appearing by the side of ┼Ъr─л ┼Ъaс╣Еkara, He (the Dh─лra┼Ыaс╣Еkara) stayed in Tilvaraс╣Зya. The Universal Preceptor having adorned the seat of K─БmaP─лс╣нha, He wandered through the earth triumphant of having wiped off the arrogance of the adherents/scholars of rival schools in eight quarters (of the earth) and established the doctrine of Advaita. He ┼Ъaс╣Еkarendra, having conquered easily the Kashmiri scholars Girodbhaс╣нс╣нa and others, ascended the Sarvaj├▒aP─лс╣нha in Kashmir and though being followed by disciples to the ─Аtreya caves (in the Himalayas), disappeared alive in the embodied form itself. Thus, the preceptor sage spreading/showering the tenets of Advaya on this sacred earth for fifty-two years and with a desire to spread this noble path in the other world, He disappeared on the new moon day in the month of ─Ас╣г─Бс╕Нha of the Uttarayaс╣Зa in the year Siddh─Бrthi of Kali era 3914. The sage Saccidvil─Бsa became the preceptor. This preceptor is tur─лyat─лta-┼Ъaс╣Еkara. Some scholars mistake him to be ┼Ъr─л ┼Ъaс╣Еkara Bhagavadp─Бda and compile biography with inconsistencies.

Having stayed in the P─лс╣нha for thirty-seven years, He reached the Supreme Abode at Aruс╣З─Бcala on the New moon day of the month ─Ас╣г─Бс╕Нha in the year ─В┼Ыvara. Observed on day 23 of July (gregorian) month. Julian date was converted to Gregorian in this reckoning. The event has been commemorated since it occurred in 1660 (gregorian era).  
AshADha k1  bAji prabhu deshpANDe leading ~300 men died holding back Adil-shAhi african general siddi masud's 10k soldiers in a narrow pass while shivAji leading his 300 escaped to vishAlgad fort (having earlier let his barber take his place while escaping from another beseiged fort) and announced his safe arrival with a cannon-fire. PS: vishAlgad was already under siege by Bijapuri sardars Suryarao Surve and Jaswantrao Dalvi. it's a thrilling tale, akin to tale of the spartans holding back the persians at the narrow pass at Thermopylae.

Observed on ┼Ъukla-Da┼Ыam─л tithi of ┼Ъr─Бvaс╣Зaс╕е (lunar) month (Apar─Бhс╣Зaс╕е/vyaapti). The event has been commemorated since it occurred in 4687 (kali era).  
┼Ъivar─Бmakс╣Ыс╣гс╣Зa, son of Parame┼Ыvara on the banks of river Pamp─Б, devoted to Sad─Б┼Ыiva, having got initiation into asceticism from him, devoid of any attachment indeed, He remained at the abode of goddess K─Бm─Бkс╣г─л. Devoted to the worship of ┼Ъr─л Cakrar─Бja, adhered to the path of ┼Ъivar─Бja, adhered to the path of ┼Ъivayoga, adept in worshipping the goddess K─Бme┼Ыvar─л, He, free from desires, held the preceptorship for fortyseven years. This senior preceptor, courageous, reached the space that is beyond the physical body, on the tenth day of the bright fortnight of the ┼Ъravaс╣Зa month in the year P─Бrthiva of the ┼Ъaka era 1508 (D┼лra ┼Ъaka). According to scholars, this preceptor was the master of Sad─Б┼Ыivabrahmendra and attained siddhi in ┼Ъvet─Бraс╣Зyam.

Observed on Kс╣Ыс╣гс╣Зa-Aс╣гс╣нam─л tithi of ┼Ъr─Бvaс╣Зaс╕е (lunar) month (Apar─Бhс╣Зaс╕е/vyaapti). The event has been commemorated since it occurred in 3548 (kali era).  
Son of ┼Ъr─л Acyuta┼Ыarm─Б of Koс╣Еkaс╣Зade┼Ыa, having offered his services of preparing sandal paste for the worship of ┼Ъr─л Chandramoul─л┼Ыvara, He was offered kingship of Kashmir by King Harс╣гa for his poetical wisdom/merits. Having ruled Kashmir for a short period, He came back to his preceptor Arbhaka┼Ыaс╣Еkara and got initiated into asceticism with the name S─Бrvabhauma Chandrac┼лс╕Нendra Sarasvat─л. Preceptor ┼Ъr─л Chandrac┼лс╕Нendra Sarasvat─л leading for ten years a pious life on the banks of Ganges, establishing on his throne revered Madhura the incarnation of Dhanvantari and adorning him with the title Parip┼лrс╣Зabodha reached/attained his LordтАЩs immortal abode on the night of Kс╣Ыс╣гс╣Зajanm─Бс╣гс╣нam─л in the year Vijaya.

Observed on ┼Ъukla-Navam─л tithi of ─А┼Ыvayujaс╕е (lunar) month (Apar─Бhс╣Зaс╕е/vyaapti). The event has been commemorated since it occurred in 3499 (kali era).  
The preceptor ┼Ъr─лkaс╣Зс╣нha, son of Ume┼Ыa ┼Ъaс╣Еkara, suffering from leprosy, worshipped S┼лrya everyday with a thousand salutations to get rid of the disease and became healthy due to the japa of ┼Ъr─лvidy─Б, renounced at the age of eighteen and reached with a tranquil mind the holy feet of the preceptor Surendrade┼Ыika. Avowed to rigoroaus practice of adhering to silence, austere, blessed with a virtue of opting his death day at his will, governed the seat of the Chief of Preceptors for thirteen years and after deputing ┼Ъaс╣Еkarendra with due instructions, reached the beatitude on the ninth day of the bright fortnight in the month of Bh─Бdrapada of the year Hevilambi.

##### рдУрдореНрдмреНрд▓-рддреБрдХрд╛рд░рд╛рдо-рд╡реАрд░рдЧрддрд┐рдГ #резрей

Observed on day 26 of November (gregorian) month. The event has been commemorated since it occurred in 2008 (gregorian era).  
tukArAm Omble dies stopping jihAdi terrorist Ajmal Kasab in Mumbai Omble joined the police as a constable in 1991 after retiring from the Indian Army's Signal Corps as a naik. He was an ASI with the Mumbai Police. On 26/11 he and his team were guarding one of the checkposts when they were approached by two terrorists in a hijacked car. After an initial shootout, one of the terrorists died inside the car, while the other, Ajmal Kasab got out of the car and lay down to pretend surrender. As unarmed Omble approached him, Kasab got up and tried to open fire. Omble stood in front of him and held on to the barrel of Kasab's rifle, thus preventing the bullets from hitting anyone else but him. The rest of the team managed to overpower and apprehend Kasab. Omble had taken over 40 bullets from an Ak-47 at point blank range and did not survive.

Observed on ┼Ъukla-Pratham─Б tithi of M─Бrga┼Ы─лrс╣гaс╕е (lunar) month (Apar─Бhс╣Зaс╕е/vyaapti). The event has been commemorated since it occurred in 3486 (kali era).  
The austere preceptor Surendra after defeating boldly in debate the materialist Durdhivi and his companion J─лva, being honoured by King Surendra in his Court merged in his original state. Preceptor Surendra, a Maharashtrian, revered by all as M─Бdhura, resorted to asceticism, an adept in Yogic practices, governed the Maс╣нha for only ten years and reached his abode on the first day of the bright fortnight in the month of M─Бrga┼Ы─лrс╣гa of the T─Бraс╣Зa year in the Kali era 3486.

The preceptor, son of Mah─Бdeva, who lived on the banks of river Vegavati, known by Lord ┼ЪivaтАЩs name, who entered into the dense forest fire to save the child, wandered through out the earth by the directions of his master and adorning the P─лс╣нha and made the four castes to adhere to their respective paths. Son of B─Бlacandrasuta named S┼лryan─Бr─Бyaс╣Зa, ┼Ъr─л Vidy─Бghanade┼Ыika was the disciple of ┼Ъr─л Cid─Бnanda. The preceptor ┼Ъr─л Vidy─Бghana, mastering the ┼Ъr─лvidy─Б held the responsibilities of the preceptor despite the atrocities of Turuс╣гkas for thirty years. The staunch adherent of asceticism, He reached the highest state of Bliss on the second day of the black fortnight in the month of Puс╣гya in the year Prabhava. This preceptor Vidy─Бghana, searching a worthy disciple to adorn the seat of the P─лс╣нha, reached Cidambaram where He handed over the responsibilities of governing (the Maс╣нha) to Dh─лra┼Ыaс╣Еkarendra and attained siddhi there itself. His preceptorship was for thirty years.
